contentrichtext.text: '''Friedrich Frey-Herosé''' (October 12, 1801, [[Lindau]] - September 22, 1873) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician. [[Image:Herose.jpg|right|thumb|Friedrich Frey-Herosé]] He was elected to the [[Swiss Federal Council]] on November 16, 1848 as one of the first seven members of the council. He was affiliated to the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland]]. During his office time he held the following departments: * [[Department of Trade and Customs]] (1848 - 1853) * [[Political Department]] (1854) * [[Military Department (Switzerland)|Military Department]] (1855 - 1859) * [[Political Department]] (1860) * [[Department of Trade and Customs]] (1861 - 1866) and was [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] twice in 1854 and 1860. He handed over office on December 31, 1866. == External links == * {{Swiss Federal Councillor|6}} * {{HDS|3760}} {{start box}} {{succession box | before = n/a one of the first seven | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1848–1866 | after = [[Emil Welti]]}} {{end box}} {{Swiss Presidents}} {{commonscat|Friedrich Frey-Herosé}} {{Authority control|VIAF=80426571}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Frey-Herose, Friedrich | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = October 12, 1801 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Lindau]] | DATE OF DEATH = September 22, 1873 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Frey-Herose, Friedrich}} [[Category:1801 births]] [[Category:1873 deaths]] [[Category:People from Lindau]] [[Category:Free Democratic Party of Switzerland politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] [[Category:Aargau politicians]] {{Switzerland-politician-stub}}
